alert.note: Alert for West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 20 at 11:29AM MDT until May 21 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...LATE SPRING STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOW TO THE MOUNTAINS, FOOTHILLS, AND FRONT RANGE URBAN CORRIDOR... .Heavy snow will will spread south across the mountains and foothills through the rest of the day, with rain changing to heavy, wet snow along the Front Range I-25 Corridor this afternoon and early evening. The heavy snow will accumulate on trees, causing some tree limbs to break and produce scattered power outages. Do not park under trees and avoid walking under snow laden trees. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 8 inches. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel may become difficult due snowfall on roadways.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
